original: Fridholm, Karl Reigin, rektor, Åmål, ■f. 6/4/9S i Mörkö, Södermani. il., av G. F. o. h. h. f. Klinga. G. 23 m. Mirjam Allard. Barn: Gunnel f. 26, Ula 29, Ylva 36. — Studiex. i Jönköp. 16, fil. mag. 22. Föret. res. t. Tyskl., Österr., Schweiz, Frankr. o. Span. Vik. lär. i Ludvika 19, i Ulricehamn 22, vik. adj. i Sundsvall 23, vik. tlär. i Boden 23-24, e. o. lär. i Örnsköldsvik 24-29, vik. lär. i Skänninge 30, ord. ämneslär. o. rektor där 31, adj. v. samrealsk. i Skänninge 44, rektor 44, rektor Åmåls samreaiLsk. sed. 46. Skr.: övers, fr. spanskan, bl. a. arb. av Concha Espina, Miguel de Unamuno, Ramon del Valle Inclàn o. Gömez Caridlo m. fl., upps. m. m.
translated: Fridholm, Karl Reigin, principal, Åmål, born April 6, 1895 in Mörkö, Södermanland, son of G. F. Klinga and his wife. Married since 1923 to Mirjam Allard. Children: Gunnel born in 1926, Ula in 1929, and Ylva in 1936. Completed his high school studies in Jönköping in 1916, and earned a Master of Arts degree in 1922. Made several trips to Germany, Austria, Switzerland, France, and Spain. Substitute teacher in Ludvika in 1919, in Ulricehamn in 1922, acting teacher in Sundsvall in 1923, substitute teacher in Boden from 1923-1924, temporary teacher in Örnsköldsvik from 1924-1929, temporary teacher in Skänninge in 1930, permanent subject teacher and principal in Skänninge in 1931, deputy principal of Skänninge lower secondary school in 1944, principal in 1944, and principal of Åmål lower secondary school since 1946. Wrote translations from Spanish, among others, works by Concha Espina, Miguel de Unamuno, Ramon del Valle Inclàn and Gömez Caridlo.
